definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To produce an air current .
( transitive ) To propel by an air current (or, if under water, a water current), usually with the mouth.
examples: Blow the dust off that book and open it up.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To be propelled by an air current .
examples: The leaves blow through the streets in the fall.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , figurative ) To direct or move, usually of a person to a particular location.
( transitive ) To create or shape by blowing.
examples: to blow bubbles
to blow glass
Joe puffed on his pipe and blew a couple of smoke rings.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To force a current of air upon with the mouth, or by other means.
examples: to blow the fire

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To clear of contents by forcing air through.
examples: to blow an egg
to blow one’s nose
The submarine blew its main ballast tanks.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cause to make sound by blowing (as a musical instrument).
examples: Blow your horn! That car is about to hit us!

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To make a sound as a result of being blown.
examples: In the harbor, the ships’ horns blew .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , of a cetacean ) To exhale visibly through the spout the seawater which it has taken in while feeding .
examples: There’s nothing more thrilling to the whale watcher than to see a whale surface and blow .
There she blows ! (i.e. “I see a whale spouting!”)

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To burst or explode ; to occur suddenly
examples: Get away from that burning gas tank! It’s about to blow !

definitions.definition: ( transitive , with "up" or with prep phrase headed by "to" ) To cause to explode, shatter, or be utterly destroyed.
examples: The demolition squad neatly blew the old hotel up.
The aerosol can was blown to bits.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cause the sudden destruction of.
examples: He blew the tires and the engine.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , historical , military ) To blow from a gun ( method of executing a person ) .
( intransitive ) To suddenly fail or give way destructively.
examples: He tried to sprint, but his ligaments blew and he was barely able to walk to the finish line.

definitions.definition: ( ergative , of a fuse ) To melt away because of overcurrent , creating a gap in a wire , thus stopping a circuit from operating.
( transitive , slang ) To recklessly squander .
examples: I managed to blow $1000 at blackjack in under an hour.
I blew $35 thou on a car.
We blew an opportunity to get benign corporate sponsorship.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , informal , idiomatic ) To fail at; to mess up ; to make a mistake in.
examples: I blew it and forgot to start the spaghetti, so I had plenty of sauce and no pasta.
Good luck, and don’t blow it!

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , stative , slang , sometimes considered vulgar ) To be very undesirable .
examples: This blows !

definitions.definition: ( transitive , vulgar ) To perform oral sex on (someone); to fellate .
examples: Who did you have to blow to get those backstage passes?

definitions.definition: ( transitive , slang ) To leave , especially suddenly or in a hurry .
examples: Let’s blow this joint.

definitions.definition: ( Scientology , intransitive ) To leave the Church of Scientology in an unauthorized manner.
( transitive ) To make flyblown ; to defile or spoil, especially with fly eggs.
( intransitive ) (of a fly) To lay eggs ; to breed (in flesh or meat).
( obsolete , transitive ) To spread by report; to publish; to disclose.
( obsolete , transitive ) To inflate, as with pride; to puff up.
( intransitive ) To breathe hard or quick; to pant ; to puff .
( transitive ) To put out of breath ; to cause to blow from fatigue .
( dated , intransitive ) To talk loudly; boast ; brag .
( slang , dated , transitive ) To slander , insult , critique or discredit (someone); to reprimand or scold (someone).
( UK , slang , archaic , transitive ) To expose , or inform on .
( intransitive , slang , informal , African-American Vernacular ) To sing .
examples: That girl has a wonderful voice; just listen to her blow !

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , slang , colloquial ) To flatulate or defecate .
examples: Uh, oh! I gotta blow !

definitions.definition: To blossom ; to cause to bloom or blossom.

main_definition: To blossom ; to cause to bloom or blossom.
